name: antsama
text: A comment left by antsama was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, lamelliform, whoper, Ebessan, Flaaron, Tragic_Johnson, Doc_Rostov, Shinkicka, pquinn87)

name: lizjones
text: Dude, that's Gramma K! She's the reason Beef's afraid of creeks!

name: tellumo
text: Although I am pretty sure this is the only time we see her "on screen."

name: greyfield
text: And with good reason. Lady's crazy.

name: pumpinpedal
text: I actually think she appears on the grand wedding.

name: pumpinpedal
text: Just had to make sure.. and the sleeping pills ran out last night anyway. http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua8s5mHx , square 4.

name: duperando
text: Actually, that's Doc Andretti's mother. I thought the same thing at first though.

name: vampirotica
text: aw man, spoiler :(

name: cracklewater
text:
I know the dude has strange cares, but Beef seems to use creeks as an aid to meditation (or was that only when he was younger?).

Coincidentally, in one of the few strips where we hear his mom's voice, the sequence ends with him in his parka, floating down the creek.

Since this was presumably the time he left the care Corliss, maybe Gramma K instilled the Fear after this event.

Also: No No is already sliding up behind Beef, jonesin' to perform the murder act. Creepy!

name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by 7th_shot, drago25, _cheesekayke, Ebessan, nutmeg)

name: stuart
text: What, a pair of striped socks is all it takes for you to consider someone Gothy McJohnnydepp?

name: bpmead
text: Absolutely.

name: peterjoel
text: I don't think I can imagine Molly as Helena Bohnam Carter... They both have infinite appeal - but in their own unique ways...

name: charchar
text: Striped stockings are truly the acme of nudity-prevention.

name: belgand
text: While an intriguing idea I think that striped stockings combined exclusively with nudity is actually greatly superior and up there with the best of all human achievements.

name: genequagmire
text: Yea and verily.

name: greenkoolayd
text: (in many cases) nudity-prevention is the enemy.

name: luke_johnson
text: Gramma K is who raised Beef after his mom shot his dad and went to jail.  At least, I think that's what happened.

name: flynn
text: I have never seen quite such a combination of cutoffs and striped tights before. Is Molly really from a time of pirate ships and thus has an awkward concept of modern dress, or am I just reading too much into this?

name: catachresis
text:
I think you are kind of right.
Damn, if I met a girl with a strange pirate dress sense who liked reclusive folks who have myriad personal issues with their own egos and problems with intimacy, I'd...
Erm...
"I'D HIT THAT!!!!!!!!"
(That's what you say on the Internet, yes?)

name: flynn
text: See yes exactly it is what my roommate used to refer to as "sticking my dick in bear traps" but it is not the kind of thing I have ever truly regretted.

name: old_odanger
text: i love your icon

name: heccibiggs
text: Man, y'all are sheltered. Come to London and visit Camden. You'll be spoilt for choice.

name: flynn
text: Hey, I'm at the airport. Can you pick me up?

name: apocowarg
text: Oh Flynn, you lovable rapscallion.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
according to her wikipedia entry, Molly "was born in seventeenth-century Wales. She died in the wreck of the Gwynqeathe. "

ironically, this puts her first life smack dab in the middle of the classic era of piracy, perhaps explaining the tights.

though that doesn't explain my wife's same appreciation of them.

name: 1000hz
text: But Molly knows Computer Science.

name: pohlhoud
text:
Check out her early blogs too.

" When I was a kid we had a lot of Bill Cosby's old comedy albums around, and I always used to play them. Why Is There Air, Right!, Wonderfulness, Himself, Revenge, I Started Out As A Child, etc. "

Somehow i think Cosby isn't that old.

name: connellingus
text: She was still a small child when the ship sank, so maybe she aged in Heaven.

name: stormagnet
text: I could totally see that. Somehow, being trapped forever in a child's body doesn't mesh with the heaven we'd seen so far. And instant adulthood would suck equally.

name: sirfrederick
text: Old old comment, but I was actually the dude who added that info to wiki. Normally if I'm adding anything, it's scathing criticisms of wallpaper, but in this case, it was that.

name: tbtabby
text: Attractive female   Striped stockings = hot. An immutable truth in any era. Molly knows this.

name: tbtabby
text: Okay... "Attractive female PLUS striped stockings EQUALS hot." Any reason why the symbols didn't show?

name: laserblade
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
yeah...basically.

...Assetbar.

name: achilleselbow
text: You must not live in Williamsburg (Brooklyn). This is pretty much standard hipster dance party attire.

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tekende, TonyHighwind, gnjdfsgk)

name: tellumo
text: Well, there is another Williamsburg , and I sometimes think of one when I should be thinking of the other. This usually ends up making me feel like my brain shifted gears without the clutch.

name: apocowarg
text: I have to say when I hear "Williamsburg" I think of the one in Pennsylvania first and then of the one in Virginia that Tellumo posted. As there are 13 states with a town called Williamsburg (not counting Williamsburg County in South Carolina) I don't think it is that outrageous to identify it the way Achillesbow did.

name: apocowarg
text: I just noticed your username is actually "achilles elbow ".

name: unsentletter
text:
I have seen ladies who dress that way.

There are many of that like in California; I promise you I would not kid you about this.

I would not kid you about this on the internets.

name: flynn
text: I appreciate your candor concerning this matter on the internets.

name: belgand
text: There is such as a lady who dresses like a pirate-type lady with striped stockings and plays the accordion down on the pier every Saturday at the farmer's market. She is completely awesome.

name: greenkoolayd
text: did you get all up in her pastry puff?

name: wehavemagnums
text: Introducing Grandma Kazenzakis

name: delzhand
text: Daaaaamn!  Look at the size of Grandma K's whiskey jug!

name: jdhenry105
text: That's probably a jug of cheap wine.

name: liquidcruelty
text: I'm going to wager that's a jug of Carlo Rossi, which is in fact cheap wine.  Not the worst thing in the world if you're like me and don't know anything about wine except that you like either the really expensive or the really cheap kind.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ...you could buy a wholotta Mum's...

name: godfatherofsouls
text: spodeeodee

name: twohundredninety
text: "They was cured of many things at once" = 5.

name: epicurus
text: Trouble Man and No-No are amazing.

name: tombsgrave
text: Onstad's at his best writing esoteric freaks, one of whom cannot speak.  Trouble Man's got the best character voice ever.

name: caduceo
text: They was cured of many things at once. I like how threatening yet non-specific this line is.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
gramma k: drinkin' hooch out of a wine glass.

pure class.

name: stuart
text: I think that counts as a snifter?

name: centipede_damascus
text: Trouble Man and No-no have stood in that exact same spot for time upon times. They saw the construction of the building, and they saw it burn down.

name: rowboat
text: Well, they did move enough to burn the building down. You don't think they just happened to be there, right? They're evil , jack!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and Godot will be there tomorrow.

name: aaron_haynes
text: This is basically exactly the impression I have of Gramma K's life: wheelchair, drawn blinds, dark room, jug of wine, day after day after day.

name: siah
text: Gramma K. reminds me of Cancer Man from X-Files.

name: jordstar
text: No No is already sneaking up behind Beef. I never noticed that before.

name: jonnay
text: Dude, you know that jug has at least three X's inscribed on it.

name: cinderfella
text: Nah, it should have a good Achewood name like Liquid Banjo or Old Windmill. I would call my whisky 'This Earth, Our Hospital' or 'Bad Collusion'

name: heccibiggs
text: Those sound more like band names. For a simple whisky name, put "Old" in front of anything. Old Bookends. Old Monitor. Old Holepunch. Okay, is it obvious that I'm just looking around the room for inspiration?

name: mattylite
text: I love lamp.

name: unsentletter
text:
OK! Then it'd be Old Lamplighter whiskey.

Done.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
Old Lamplaughter

that's how it should be.

name: invidious
text: Ancient Shenanigans

name: thehelmet
text: I love... carpet.

name: mrclumpy
text: She died back to life? I hope that's what happened, because that would be awesome.

name: zapatos
text: Those are some rad stockings Molly.

name: apparentlypants
text: A match made in heaven
